page.title: 09Beekeeping/Kirtlebridge
page.content: This area is not a particularly good one for bees. The flora is very restricted because so much of the grassland is manured with artificial fertilisers which kill the clover. Other nectar-producing plants are rare in cultivated land because of the use of herbicides. Most of the nectar comes from sycamore in May and willowherb in July/August. I have 18 colonies of bees which I keep as a hobby rather than a commercial venture. The fascination of beekeeping as a hobby stems partly from the study of bees' behaviour and partly from the challenge of trying to control creatures which are not domesticated and are more than able to retaliate when they are ill-treated. Honey yields range from about 30lbs per colony, in a good year, to nil in a bad year.
